title: Estel Roman Quarry
description: A limestone quarry from which was sourced the stone used in the construction of the Pont du Gard. The quarry was excavated in the late 1990s and early 2000s on a site 600-700 meters northeast of the aqueduct bridge.

properties.description: 1:500,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 7251
